body: Version of support library should be r13
And here too.
Version of ABS should be 4.3.2-SNAPSHOT
It's r13, there is the 13.0.0 in the compile line.
Should. Be. r13. Or this action broke a build?
Um, stop. You should use `com.google.android:support-v4:r13`.

These are the artifacts in the Support Repository in the SDK, so it's not
r13, it's exactly like I have in the file.

com.android.support:support-v4:13.0.0
com.android.support:support-v13:13.0.0
com.android.support:gridlayout-v7:13.0.0

No, it's exactly like I have.
You have the post here from the guy writing the Gradle build system for
Android:
https://plus.google.com/+XavierDucrohet/posts/QJSbh5e1zEa

On Wed, Jun 19, 2013 at 3:22 PM, Sergey Shatunov
notifications@github.comwrote:

> In library/build.gradle:
> 
> > @@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
> > +apply plugin: 'android-library'
> > +
> > +repositories {
> > -  mavenLocal()
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +dependencies {
> > -  compile 'com.android.support:support-v4:13.0.0'
> 
> Um, stop. You should use com.google.android:support-v4:r13.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/Prototik/HoloEverywhere/pull/504/files#r4771911
> .

## 

Henrique Rocha
Android Developer @ AndroidPIT.de
Yet HoloEverywhere will not use `Android Support Repository` from sdk.

Yes, you can merge it anyway because now the JAR is there.
Only people using Gradle to build will use the support library from SDK,
everyone else will continue to work as they have been working.
Gradle files are totally non-intrusive.
Okay, but anyway you don't should remove `android-support-v4-r13.jar` while.
Yes, that's why I put the file back in, sorry for removing. :)
But resbuilder will remove this xmlns declaration with the first trying to package library. Please remove it and it's usages below, then I'll merge this pr.
`setMeasuredDimensionCompat`, not `setMeasuredDimensionsCompat`

Ok, as I wrote I never used resbuilder. So please check also the change in yml file. 
How can I invoke resbuilder?
Good catch, I'll correct that

Any gradle-based action. Eg. compiling demo project or something else.
But you can invoke it manually: ./gradlew resbuilderMain (or run this task in studio's menu)

diff_hunk:
@@ -1,12 +1,12 @@
 android {
     compileSdkVersion 19
-    buildToolsVersion '19.0.3'
+    buildToolsVersion '19.1.0'
 
     defaultConfig {
         minSdkVersion 7
         targetSdkVersion 19
 
-        versionName '2.1.1-SNAPSHOT'
+        versionName '2.1.1.1-SNAPSHOT'
body: Come back `2.1.1-SNAPSHOT` and I'll merge it.
There too.
